intro: Pilea pumila var. obtusifolia, commonly known as the woolly pilea, is a compact, low-growing plant native to Southeast Asia. It features small, round, velvety leaves that are typically a deep green with a slight sheen. The leaves are often described as being covered in a fine, fuzzy texture, giving the plant its characteristic "woolly" appearance. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish-white in color. This plant thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
